subject: EXPECT CLOUDY SKIES WITH LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS TO CONTINUE PUSHING IN FROM THE EAST.
body:
ERMX Grabs Edge Of US Trade With China And Moves Into Nitride Devices!

EntreMetrix Inc. (ERMX)
$0.16

Congress's push to increase trade agreements with China gives ERMX huge
advantage as they enter joint venture to manufacture Nitride Devices for
military, energy and technological solutions in China. This is huge. Get
on ERMX Monday!

THE PRIMARY HAZARD WILL BE CONTINUED HEAVY RAINFALL OF AN ADDITIONAL ONE
TO TWO INCHES IN A SHORT PERIOD OF TIME. AREAS OF LOW CLOUDS AND FOG ARE
QUICKLY DEVELOPING ACROSS MUCH OF NORTHEAST ALABAMA EARLY THIS MORNING.
CLOUDY SKIES WITH A FEW SPRINKLES DEVELOPING THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING
HOURS. PATCHY FOG WITH ISOLATED SHOWERS THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING HOURS.
CLOUDY SKIES WITH A FEW SPRINKLES DEVELOPING THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING
HOURS.

CLOUDY SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS.
AND ADDITIONAL RAINS WILL LIKELY RESULT IN PONDING OF WATER AROUND LOW
LYING AREAS AS WELL AS STANDING WATER ON SOME ROADWAYS.

IF TRAVELING THIS MORNING.

GREEN AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES.

THE LOW CLOUD DECK AND AREAS OF FOG ALONG THE COAST LINE WILL CREEP
WESTWARD AND SLIGHTLY SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE EVENING.

AND ADDITIONAL RAINS WILL LIKELY RESULT IN PONDING OF WATER AROUND LOW
LYING AREAS AS WELL AS STANDING WATER ON SOME ROADWAYS.
RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL BE UP TO ONE QUARTER OF AN INCH.

THE STEESE HIGHWAY FROM TWELVE MILE SUMMIT TO FOX WILL CONTINUE TO HAVE
RAIN SHOWERS. CLOUDY SKIES WITH A FEW SPRINKLES DEVELOPING THROUGH THE
EARLY MORNING HOURS. CLOUDY SKIES WITH A FEW SPRINKLES DEVELOPING
THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING HOURS.

ONE TO TWO INCHES OF RAINFALL HAS ALREADY FALLEN ACROSS PARTS OF GEORGE.
CLOUDY SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS.

THE LOW CLOUD DECK AND AREAS OF FOG ALONG THE COAST LINE WILL CREEP
WESTWARD AND SLIGHTLY SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE EVENING.

DO NOT DRIVE YOUR VEHICLE INTO WATER COVERED ROADWAYS. THE RAIN IS
EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO DECREASE IN COVERAGE AND WEAKEN OVERNIGHT.
THE DEPTH MAY BE TOO GREAT TO ALLOW A SAFE CROSSING.
STRONGEST WINDS NEAR LYNN CANAL. PATCHY FOG WITH ISOLATED SHOWERS
THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING HOURS. This same information is available in
other file formats including the XML based RSS and CAP formats. This
file is usually updated about every two minutes. IF TRAVELING THIS
MORNING. DECREASING SLOWLY THROUGH THE NIGHT.

THE STEESE HIGHWAY FROM TWELVE MILE SUMMIT TO FOX WILL CONTINUE TO HAVE
RAIN SHOWERS. MOSTLY NEAR THE ELLIOTT HIGHWAY. AND WELL INLAND EAST OF
BARROW.
THE RAIN IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO DECREASE IN COVERAGE AND WEAKEN
OVERNIGHT.
CLOUDY SKIES WITH A FEW SPRINKLES DEVELOPING THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING
HOURS.
